meanings.definition: The quality or state of being productive or fertile.
meanings.sent1: The fruitfulness of the apple tree was evident in the abundance of ripe apples hanging from its branches.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's hard work in the fields led to a season of great fruitfulness.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome chuckled at the fruitfulness of the tomato plant, as it seemed to be growing tomatoes as big as his head.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of ideas, blooming with the fruitfulness of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The sun shone down on the fields, encouraging the fruitfulness of the crops to flourish.

meanings.definition: The ability to produce good results or be successful.
meanings.sent1: The fruitfulness of the new marketing strategy was evident in the increase in sales.
meanings.sent2: Hard work and dedication are key factors in achieving fruitfulness in any endeavor.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the fruitfulness of his latest joke, which had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the soil in which the fruitfulness of her dreams took root and grew.
meanings.sent5: The team celebrated the fruitfulness of their collaboration, which led to a successful project completion.
